title: Customer Success Account Management
description:
Are you excited about how innovative tech can be used for business and societal growth? Are you a business minded, result driven person with a curious mind? We are looking for a person with passion for people, business and tech, and the magic that occurs in the intersection of the three.
   

  

 With over 17,000 employees worldwide, the mission of the Customer Experience & Success (CE&S) organization is to empower customers to accelerate business value through differentiated customer experiences that leverage Microsoft’s products, services, and partnerships. Come join CE&S and help us build a future where customers achieve their business outcomes faster with technology that does more.
   

  

 As a Senior Customer Success Account Manager, you are the primary delivery and operations lead and a partner for our more strategic customers, empowering them to achieve more by accelerating their value realization across our Digital Cloud platforms. Our focus is the Telco, Retail and Energy industries. By leveraging your business acumen, industry perspectives and technical insights you will be responsible for the end-to-end post sales delivery across the Microsoft and Partner ecosystem, to align the right resources at the right time to achieve customer business outcomes.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Customer Relationship Management
+ Creates, influences, and evolves healthy, strategic relationships with key customer stakeholders, partners, and technical professionals to lead quality solution delivery and health, using partnerships with other account team leaders and lead orchestration across internal/external stakeholders.

* Customer Success Leadership - Customer Strategy and Growth
+ Drives conversations with customers to demonstrate alignment between customer objectives and the current Microsoft portfolio of work in the customer account.
+ Aligns with the account team to link Customer Success Plans with account plan priorities and develop bookable programs of work.

* Customer Success Leadership – Delivery and Program Management
+ In partnership with key stakeholders and executives, develops and delivers strategic roadmaps for executing program planning and customer-facing program review, prioritizing engagements, and influencing key stakeholder and executive expectations to address agreed-upon customer outcomes and account priorities to deliver ongoing customer success.

* Customer Success Leadership - Consumption Leadership
+ Partners with customers to understand their business objectives and priorities, identify cross-selling and add-on opportunities, optimize usage, drive adoption, prioritize Microsoft products and services delivery to meet the most critical agreed-upon customer outcomes and account priorities, and develop and execute Customer Success plans to meet them in order to manage consumption holistically across the entire portfolio.

* Technical Relevance
+ Leverages foundational industry, technical expertise, and visionary mindset to enable customer success.


**Qualifications**
**Required/Minimum Qualifications**
* Master's Degree in Business, Sociology, Psychology, Computer Science, or related field AND experience in customer success, solution delivery, practice management, customer-facing consulting, or portfolio management experience
+ OR Bachelor's Degree in Business, Sociology, Psychology, Computer Science or related field ANDexperience in customer success, solution delivery, practice management, customer-facing consulting, or portfolio management experience
+ OR equivalent experience.


**Additional Preferred Qualifications**
* Master's Degree in Business, Sociology, Psychology, Computer Science, or related field AND experience in customer success, solution delivery, practice management, customer-facing consulting, or portfolio management experience
+ OR Bachelor's Degree in Business, Sociology, Psychology, Computer Science or related field AND experience in customer success, solution delivery, practice management, customer-facing consulting, or portfolio management experience
+ OR equivalent experience.

* Solid years relevant work experience within customer industry.
* Business acumen and extensive experience of driving value based business dialogues.
* Microsoft or competitor equivalent (e.g., AWS) certification in relevant technologies (e.g., Azure, 365).
* Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) Foundation certification or equivalent service management certification.
+ Project Management Institute (PMI) or equivalent Project Management certification.


 Prosci or equivalent Change Management certification.
   

  

 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Chief of Staff to Chief Product Officer
description:
Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 175,000 businesses - including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others - rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
 



 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
 



 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
 







**About the role** 




 As Chief of Staff to the Chief Product Officer at Sinch, you will serve as a strategic force multiplier and trusted advisor, enabling the CPO to drive transformational impact across our global communications platform serving 175,000+ customers worldwide.
 



 You will operate at the intersection of strategy and execution, ensuring alignment between the product organization and the broader company while managing critical initiatives that require executive-level coordination. Your work will span strategic planning, M&A integration, organizational transformation, executive communications, and cross-functional leadership.
 



 This role is essential to translating product vision into organizational reality as Sinch scales its product excellence and accelerates innovation across our comprehensive portfolio of messaging, email, voice, and communications platform products.
 



 The role is based at SINCH HQ in Stockholm, Sweden and report to SINCH CPO.
 







**Responsibilities** 




**Strategic Partnership & Advisory** 



* Serve as primary strategic partner to the CPO on product strategy, organizational priorities, and business-critical decisions
* Participate in executive leadership team meetings, board preparation, and strategic planning sessions alongside the CPO
* Provide strategic counsel on complex organizational challenges, synthesizing diverse inputs into clear recommendations
* Represent the CPO in meetings and forums when needed, ensuring consistent decision-making and follow-through



**Strategic Planning & Governance** 



* Lead annual and quarterly strategic planning processes for the product organization, working closely with Product Operations, Engineering, Marketing, Finance, and Corporate Strategy
* Facilitate development of product organization OKRs (Objectives and Key Results) aligned with company-wide objectives in partnership with Product Operations
* Partner with Product Operations to ensure strategic planning integrates with operational planning, portfolio management, and resource allocation
* Partner with Product Operations on governance frameworks for product investment decisions, resource allocation, and portfolio prioritization



**Organizational Transformation & Change Management** 



* Drive execution of organizational transformation initiatives as Sinch builds a unified product organization
* Design and implement change management strategies to ensure adoption of new processes, structures, and ways of working
* Track transformation progress against milestones, adjusting approach based on feedback and results



**Executive Communication & Stakeholder Management** 



* Manage CPO's executive communication strategy, including internal updates, board materials, investor relations, and external communications
* Prepare high-quality executive presentations and strategic documents for board meetings, quarterly business reviews, and all-hands meetings
* Serve as primary liaison between CPO and other executive leadership team members, ensuring alignment and coordination



**Strategic Initiative & Program Coordination** 



* Own end-to-end coordination of strategic initiatives that span multiple teams or functions. Ensure strategic initiatives have clear owners, success metrics, timelines, and governance
* Provide executive visibility into initiative status, risks, and outcomes through regular reporting



**M&A Strategy & Integration** 



* Partner with Corporate Development and Corporate Strategy teams on product-related M&A evaluation, due diligence, and integration planning
* Lead product organization aspects of M&A integration, ensuring successful consolidation of acquired product teams, processes, and portfolios
* Synthesize lessons learned from integrations and divestitures to continuously improve Sinch's portfolio management capabilities







**About you** 




**Requirements** 



* Proven experience in chief of staff, strategy, product management or senior operational roles supporting C-level executives
* Proven experience at global high-growth technology companies, particularly B2B SaaS, CPaaS, or multi-product platforms
* Proven track record managing complex, cross-functional initiatives in dynamic environments
* Experience with M&A integration, organizational transformation, or large-scale change management strongly preferred
* Fluency in English







**Skills & Capabilities:** 




**Strategic Thinking** 
 : Ability to synthesize complex information, identify patterns, and frame strategic choices clearly
 



**Executive Presence** 
 : Confidence operating at executive levels, representing the CPO effectively in high-stakes situations
 



**Communication Excellence** 
 : Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with ability to craft compelling narratives for diverse audiences
 



**Analytical Rigor** 
 : Strong business and financial acumen, comfortable with data analysis and quantitative reasoning
 



**Organizational Savvy** 
 : Deep understanding of how organizations work, with ability to navigate complexity and build coalitions
 



**Execution Focus** 
 : Track record of driving initiatives to completion, with attention to detail and follow-through
 



**Interpersonal Skills** 
 : High emotional intelligence, strong relationship-building skills, and ability to influence without authority
 



**Adaptability** 
 : Comfort with ambiguity, able to shift priorities quickly while maintaining quality and progress
 







**Our hiring process** 




 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
 







 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Quality Assurance Manager
description:
**QA Manager – Evolan**
*Evolan är ett snabbt växande svenskt läkemedelsföretag beläget i Danderyd, med ett dedikerat team på cirka 30 medarbetare.* 
*Som en av de snabbast växande aktörerna i läkemedelsbranschen utökar vi kontinuerligt vår produktportfölj som omfattar både receptbelagda- och receptfria läkemedel, medicintekniska produkter, kosmetika och kosttillskott.* 
*Med fokus på kvalitet, utveckling, marknadsföring och försäljning är Evolan engagerat i ständig tillväxt och innovation.*
 Vi söker nu en QA Manager till vår kvalitetsavdelning. I denna viktiga roll kommer du att ansvara för hantering av reklamationer, avvikelser samt vara systemadministratör för vårt kvalitetsledningssystem. Du kommer att ha ett nära samarbete med olika funktioner internt och med våra externa partners som befinner sig över hela Europa och världen.
   

  

 Som systemadministratör kommer du att spela en viktig roll i förbättringsprojekten vi driver av våra kvalitetsprocesser, men det innebär även underhåll av systemet för att säkerställa att det är uppdaterat.
   

  

 Varför Evolan?
   

  

 På Evolan erbjuder vi en dynamisk, entusiastisk och stimulerande arbetsmiljö. Vi har en familjär kultur där varje individs insats är viktig och synlig i hela organisationen. Med en platt hierarki och en liten organisation finns det stora möjligheter för personlig och professionell utveckling. Genom att arbeta hos oss får du en bred inblick i en växande produktportfölj och möjlighet att utvecklas inom flera områden i läkemedelsindustrin.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som:
   

  

* Har en akademisk utbildning inom naturvetenskap.
* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet från läkemedelsbranschen, helst från ett tillverkande läkemedelsföretag.
* Är initiativrik, resultatdriven och ser utmaningar som möjligheter.
* Behärskar både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
* Är noggrann, lösningsorienterad och en skicklig kommunikatör som kan bygga effektiva relationer med både kunder och leverantörer.
* Har ett intresse för IT-system och ser fram emot att ta dig an rollen som systemadministratör.
* Tänker utanför boxen, trivs med förändring och utveckling.


 Vad vi erbjuder:
   

  

* En trivsam arbetsmiljö.
* Möjlighet att ta på dig ett brett ansvarsområde och utvecklas i din roll.
* Chansen att vara en del av ett växande företag med en mångsidig och spännande produktportfölj.


 Om du är redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och vill bli en del av Evolans spännande resa ser vi fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Ansökan:
   

  

 Skicka din ansökan till ansokan@evolan.se senast 2025-12-01, med ämnesraden "QA Manager".
   

  

 För ytterligare frågor eller mer information om tjänsten, vänligen kontakta Karin Hultman/Kvalitetschef:
   

  

 Mobil: +46 703 49 69 15
   

  

 E-post: Karin.Hultman@evolan.se
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att ta emot din ansökan!

title: Internship: Data Quality & Governance in Supply Chain
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Are you ready to make a visible impact from day one? Join us as a hands-on intern to transform how Group Supply manages and trusts its data. This is a high-visibility role where your work will directly improve operational efficiency, enable better decisions, and shape the future of our supply capabilities. You’ll be mentored by senior data professionals, work with cross-functional teams, and deliver tangible results that matter to the business.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Identify critical master and operational data, map single sources of truth, data owners, and quality metrics
* Address missing data issues, both current and historical
* Conduct root cause analysis to diagnose data quality and availability problems
* Implement Data Governance roles and responsibilities across business and data teams
* Support develop and implement a data governance framework and collaboration model
* Execute systematic quality control and drive improvement actions
* Recover and validate historical master data critical for future ways of working


**The skills you bring:**
* Ongoing studies: Industrial Engineering, Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Information Systems, Data Science/Business Analytics, Computer Science or related BSc/MSc programmes
* Strong understanding of data management principles and data governance
* Experience with root cause analysis and quality control processes
* Ability to collaborate across teams and define governance roles and processes
* Analytical mindset and attention to detail
* Interest in sustainable data governance and continuous improvement


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 775741

title: Web Engineer
description:
We’re looking for a
 **Web Engineer** 
 to help design and build a shared TypeScript SDK that centralizes reusable platform libraries, tools, and best practices. This SDK will make it easier for teams across our client to integrate with internal web infrastructure, improve consistency, and accelerate development workflows.
   

  

 This role is embedded within a broader platform mission rather than a single product team. You'll work in close collaboration with internal advisors, participate in a lightweight standup cadence, and lead a focused, well-scoped project. While not part of a formal team, you’ll be supported by stakeholders across the company.
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

  

* Design and develop a shared TypeScript SDK for use across our clients internal web stack.
* Consolidate platform libraries, gRPC wrappers, and common utilities.
* Engage directly with web infra teams to align on best practices and encourage adoption.
* Contribute to developer experience improvements through documentation and tooling.
* Join web-focused ceremonies (advisory boards, check-ins) and collaborate across platform missions.


 What we're looking for
   

  

* Strong expertise in TypeScript, including structuring libraries and reusable modules.
* Solid understanding of web infrastructure, including dependency management, build tooling, and API integration (e.g., gRPC).
* Ability to operate autonomously, navigate ambiguity, and drive alignment across teams.
* Comfortable interfacing with a variety of teams and disciplines to gather input and evangelize usage.
* Bonus: Experience contributing to SDKs, internal platforms, or developer experience teams.


 Start: Mid Nov
   

  

 Length: 3 months plus possibility to extend
   

  

 Remote work.

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
**SDR (Sales Development Representative)** 




  





**Ready to Transform How the World Sells?** 





 At Agaton, we're building the future of customer interactions through a revolutionary approach that combines: empowering human agents with AI-powered coaching that dramatically increases performance, while deploying autonomous AI voice agents that handle customer interactions with the sophistication and nuance of top-performing professionals.
 




  






 Our autonomous agents don't just follow scripts - they understand context, adapt to customer needs in real-time, and deliver personalized experiences that feel genuinely human. They can handle complex customer interactions, understand objections, and build relationships while maintaining the highest standards of professionalism and authenticity.
 




  






 We're not just improving customer interactions - we're fundamentally changing it for the better. Sales shouldn't be pushy; it should be intelligent, helpful, and genuinely valuable. Our mission is to make world-class communication accessible to everyone, whether that's through coaching human agents or through our autonomous AI agents that represent the gold standard in customer interactions.
 





 We're a high-growth, talent-dense team of machine learning engineers, software developers, and designers based in Stockholm, expanding rapidly into new markets globally. Backed by some of the best angel investors in the world, our team brings experience from industry champions like Tink, Spotify, Shopify, Zettle, PayPal, Sana, and EF.
 




  






 We're working on something that will be absolutely huge - a new category leader in AI that's solving an age-old, trillion-dollar problem for businesses globally. This is your chance to be part of something generation-defining.
 




  






 Now we’re expanding our commercial team  and looking for a new generation of
 
**SDRs** 

 who combine hustle, curiosity, and authenticity.
 




  





**The Opportunity** 





 As a
 
**Sales Development Representative** 

 at Agaton, you’ll be the engine behind our pipeline.
 





  You’ll connect with decision-makers in industries like telecom, finance, and BPO helping them understand how Agaton’s AI can transform their sales results and customer experience.
 





 This isn’t traditional cold calling.
 





 You’ll use
 
**AI-powered prospecting** 

 ,
 
**personalized storytelling** 

 , and
 
**data-driven outreach** 

 to open meaningful conversations with Europe’s leading sales organizations.
 




  





**What You’ll Be Doing** 



* Generating qualified opportunities through
 
**targeted outreach** 

 (email, LinkedIn, phone).
* Researching key accounts and identifying high-value prospects.
* Crafting personalized messaging that resonates with sales and CX leaders.
* Leveraging Agaton’s internal AI tools to optimize sequencing and outreach.
* Collaborating with stakeholders to qualify and hand off strong opportunities.
* Testing and refining outreach strategies, every week, every campaign.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* Ambitious, proactive, and unafraid to pick up the phone.
* A natural communicator who can build rapport fast and ask great questions.
* Curious about
 
**AI, technology, and human communication** 

 .
* Structured in your workflow and driven by measurable results.
* Fluent in
 
**Swedish and English** 

 , you’ll use both daily.
* Experience in B2B sales, SaaS, or outbound prospecting is a plus (but not required).



  





**What We Offer** 



* **Competitive base salary + equity** 

 — share in what you help build.
* **6 weeks paid vacation** 

 — work hard, recharge fully.
* **Wellness & learning budgets** 

 — invest in your growth.
* **Modern Stockholm HQ**
* The opportunity to master
 
**AI-first sales** 

 at one of Europe’s fastest-growing startups.

title: Risk Analyst
description:
We are looking for a Risk Analyst with focus on operational risk to join our Group Risk Control function. At NOBA, a rapidly growing bank, we offer a dynamic and engaging environment with both challenges and exciting opportunities. You will join the Operational Risk team within the Group Risk Control function, currently consisting of 12 colleagues and covering all NOBAS’s risk exposures.
   

  

 The Group Risk Control function within NOBA values wholehearted dedication, collaboration, and mutual support to foster growth and success. This role is based at our headquarter in Stockholm, at Gävlegatan 22, and reports to the Group Head of Operation Risk within the Group Risk Control function.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Working with operational risks at NOBA offers a rewarding experience. We are transitioning towards proactive operational risk frameworks, utilizing data-driven analytics and AI to enhance efficiency and insights. As an Risk Analyst, you will play a key role in strengthening NOBA’s risk management frameworks by integrating data-driven analysis and ensuring operational resilience in an increasingly digitalized environment. With growing reliance on technology, managing ICT risks is a key priority, and you will be instrumental in further strengthening this area within the broader operational risk strategy.
   

  

 In this role, you will collaborate with key stakeholders across business functions to develop, refine, and implement NOBA’s operational risk frameworks, ensuring robust controls and regulatory compliance. Additionally, you will lead and coordinate business continuity management across all NOBA’s business functions, fostering a strong risk culture.
   

  

**Specific Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To**
* Monitoring, analysing, controlling and reporting of operational risk (including ICT) across NOBA Group.
* Lead, coordinate and monitor the Business Continuity Management (BCM) activities, including Crisis Management and Incident Response and Recover.
* Maintaining close communication and coordination regarding operational risk exposures and developments with NOBA’s business functions, Tech function and other relevant internal stakeholders.
* Analysing and implementing regulatory requirements in the operational and ICT risk areas.


**We Are Looking For You Who**
* Bachelor's degree in relevant field, such as Engineering, Economics or equivalent.
* 2-4 years’ experience in risk management and internal control, preferable in audit or consultancy.
* Good writing and communications skills (English is NOBA’s main working language).
* Have the right to work in Sweden (Swedish citizenship, EU citizenship or a valid Swedish work permit).


**It's Positive If You**
* Knowledge in ICT risk management and security frameworks.
* Experience with in the financial sector.
* Experience in Power BI.
* Experience in Business Continuity and Crisis Management.
* Experience from working with implementation and/or follow up of regulatory requirements relevant for financial sector, e.g. EBA, DORA.


**To thrive and perform well in the role, we believe that you need to be:**
 Curious and analytical, with a good sense for identifying and managing complex risks. You enjoy working independently, but also value collaboration and learning from others.
   

  

 You’re a positive and proactive team player who shares ideas and lifts those around you. With strong communication skills, you adapt your message to your audience and make sure everyone feels included and informed.
   

  

 In addition to this, it is important to us that you recognize yourself in our values: we are wholehearted, we collaborate and we take the lead.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Strong growth and career development possibilities within risk management, regulatory requirements and business strategy/development.
* The possibility to grow within the Group Risk Control function.
* Experience from joining a rapidly growing banking group and organisation.
* Excellent team environment with high degree of support and personal responsibility.
* Strong feedback culture and coaching leadership.
* Work-life balance.
* Attractive compensation and benefits.
* A strong caring company culture – we really care about each other!


 Have you heard of NOBAVERSE?
   

  

 In our NOBAVERSE, we value openness, trust, and diversity. Here, you can influence your own development and have fun along the way to achieving our goals – all in a workplace that’s a little extra
 *bubbly* 
 ! ✨
   

  

 Read more about our employee value proposition on our careers page.
   

  

 We strive for diversity of knowledge and experiences among our employees and welcome all applicants who are qualified for the position. We are committed to a recruitment process free from discrimination that provides equal opportunities for all.
   

  

**What happens when you have submitted your application?**
 The number of steps in the recruitment process may vary depending on the position you are applying for, but we always try to keep the process as short and concise as possible, to protect your application experience. You can read more about how our recruitment process works in the FAQ.
   

  

 If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter Rebecca Khan at rebecca.khan@nordax.se.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application! 🙏✨
   

  

 NOBA Bank protects your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application. Examples of sensitive personal data can be information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health, such as sick leave. If you have protected personal information, please inform the responsible recruiter so that we can handle your personal data correctly.

title: Managementkonsult med erfarenhet inom offentlig sektor
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
 Inom vårt team Transformation Advisory på Sopra Steria stödjer vi ledande befattningshavare med strategi, verksamhetsutveckling och programledning av komplexa förändringsprojekt. Vår styrka ligger i att kombinera strategi, operativ verksamhet och teknologi vilket gör att vi kan hjälpa våra kunder att definiera de affärskritiska frågeställningarna – och transformera verksamheten. Vi är på en tillväxtresa och i vår tillväxt kommer det finns spännande utvecklingsmöjligheter i såväl våra konsultuppdrag som olika nyckelroller i vår organisation.
   

  

 Vi växer vår affär inom offentlig sektor och har många spännande uppdragsmöjligheter. Därför behöver vi stärka vårt team med fler Managentkonsulter med erfarenhet inom det området.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har flera års erfarenhet som managementkonsult och en gedigen kunskap inom organisations- och verksamhetsutveckling med särskild inriktning mot offentlig sektor. Du har arbetat i uppdragsledande roller och har en djup förståelse för de utmaningar och behov som finns inom offentlig sektor och myndighet. Du är van vid att genomföra förstudier, leda workshops, facilitera beslutsprocesser med olika beslutsfattare och intressenter, samt driva implementering av verksamhetsförändringar som genererar önskade effekter. Du drivs av att utveckla kundrelationer och identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter där vi som konsultpartner kan göra skillnad och skapa hållbara lösningar som gör verklig skillnad. Som person är du nyfiken, drivande och en stark team-player som trivs med att ta ansvar och samarbeta för framgång.
   

  

**Vi tror att du har:**
* Minst 6–8 års erfarenhet som managementkonsult, varav större delen inom offentlig sektor
* Akademisk examen inom relevant område
* Stor förståelse för offentlig sektors utmaningar och verksamhetsbehov
* Erfarenhet av organisation, styrning, verksamhetsutveckling och tillämpning av ny teknik för att effektivisera och förbättra verksamhetsprocesser mm.
* Dokumenterad förmåga att leda och driva komplexa förändringsprojekt
* Hög grad av självledarskap och vilja att utveckla både dig själv och andra
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift


**Varför välja oss?**
 Som medarbetare hos oss blir du en del av uttrycket ”Tillsammans når vi längre” och får arbeta tillsammans med ett genuint, nyfiket och drivet team. Samtidigt är du en del av en global koncern där vi är hela 60 000 medarbetare fördelat över 30 länder och kan vara med att påverka digitaliseringens framfart på riktigt – det är det vi menar med ”The world is how we shape it”, alltså att det vi gör för våra kunder varje dag skapar verklig förändring som formar världen och dess riktning framåt.
   

  

 Vi har en positiv kultur som tenderar att sprida sig hos våra kunder. Kulturen bygger bland annat på kunskapsdelning, självledarskap, transparens och teamwork. Med passion för människor och teknik skapar vi en bättre framtid tillsammans.
   

  

 Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller oss som bolag är du välkommen att kontakta Svante Larsson svante.larsson2@soprasteria.com
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Business Analyst IT Infrastruktur
description:
**Vi söker en erfaren Business Analyst IT Infrastruktur till vår kund inom tillverkande industri.** 




  





**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Arbeta i en agil kontext nära verksamheten med att identifiera, analysera och omsätta behov till IT-lösningar
* Ansvar för kravhantering och workshops för att skapa tydliga, verifierbara krav tillsammans med intressenter
* Arbeta bland annat nära arkitekter och verksamhetsrepresentanter för att säkerställa att lösningarna uppfyller behoven
* Leda och driva initiativ, arbeta med förstudier samt stödja projekt som oftast finns i sammanhang av IT-infrastruktur
* Mer information om uppdraget förmedlas om man går vidare i urvalet



  





**Krav:** 



* Minst 9 års relevant erfarenhet inom kravhantering, IT infrastruktur och projektledning.
* Utmärkt förmåga att läsa, skriva och tala svenska



  





**Placeringsort:** 
 Solna
 



**Omfattning:** 
 heltid på plats i kundens lokaler med möjlighet till hybrid.
 



**Start:** 
 2025-11-17
 



  





**Information:** 



* ***Säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll utförs på kundens begäran.***
* ***Ansök senast 2025-08-30***
* ***Urval av kandidater sker löpande och annonsen kan tas bort tidigare.***



  





**Om Agiremus** 




 Sedan 2015 har vi hjälpt flertalet medarbetare att komma ut på arbetsmarknaden samt att nå sina karriärmål runtom i Sverige. Genom att skapa och bibehålla meningsfulla relationer med våra samarbetspartners kan vi presentera en bred rad av arbetsmarknadens mest attraktiva karriärmöjligheter för våra medarbetare och kandidater. Agiremus verkar inom de flesta branscherna, både inom privat och offentlig sektor.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder:
 



 Agiremus erbjuder dig som konsult en spännande och utmanande arbetsplats där du ges möjlighet att utvecklas inom din roll. Vi bryr oss om dig som och strävar efter långsiktiga samarbeten. Som konsult hos oss ges du, förutom spännande uppdrag, möjlighet att dela din resa med andra konsulter. Med jämna mellanrum anordnar vi tillfällen för er att träffas genom olika aktiviteter. Självklart kommer du även att ha en engagerad kontaktperson hos oss som finns där som bollplank och stöd. Vi erbjuder dig även goda personalförmåner som:
 



  




* Anställning med fast månadslön.
* Semester enligt semesterlagen.
* Tjänstepension.
* Heltäckande sjuk och olycksfallsförsäkring dygnet runt, årets alla dagar.
* Friskvårdsbidrag m.m.



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: People & Workplace Coordinator
description:
Bruce Studios is on a mission to redefine how people train, recover, and feel good – every day.
   

  

 With thousands of members and over 1,000 partner studios across the Nordics, we offer the most flexible way to stay active and well. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re now looking for a People & Workplace Coordinator to join our Operation team in Stockholm HQ.
   

  

**Your mission**
 As People & Workplace Coordinator, your mission is to make Bruce Studios an inspiring, structured, and engaging place to work – across all our Nordic markets.
   

  

 You’ll make sure everything around our people runs smoothly: from onboarding and HR processes to office experience and team culture.
   

  

 This is a hands-on and dynamic role combining HR coordination, office management, and culture-building. You’ll be the go-to person for all things related to people and workplace – helping create an environment where our teams can thrive and focus on our shared goal: 20 million hours of movement in the Nordics.
   

  

 You’ll report to the Chief Operating Officer (COO) and collaborate closely with managers and teams across Sweden, Norway, and Denmark.
   

  

**What You´ll Do**
* Coordinate and administer people processes – from recruitment and onboarding to HR documentation and day-to-day operations
* Ensure a smooth employee experience by keeping HR systems, policies, and records organized and up to date across markets
* Take ownership of the Stockholm office – keeping it structured, welcoming, and full of energy, while handling suppliers, purchases, and practical administration
* Support teams in Oslo and Copenhagen with office and workplace coordination
* Plan and execute internal events, offsites, and initiatives that bring people together and strengthen culture
* Coordinate internal communication – newsletters, all-hands meetings, and leadership updates – to keep everyone aligned and informed
* Drive wellbeing and engagement initiatives that reflect Bruce Studios’ culture of movement and connection
* Act as a trusted partner to the COO and managers on engagement, organization, and team development topics


**What We Want You To Bring**
 We’re looking for someone structured, proactive, and people-oriented – someone who loves creating structure, building relationships, and making things run smoothly. You combine attention to detail with a genuine passion for people and workplace culture.
   

  

 Experience & skills:
   

  

* 2–4 years of experience in HR coordination, office management, or a similar role.
* Experience with recruitment coordination and basic HR administration.
* Strong organizational and multitasking skills – you thrive on keeping many processes running in parallell
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills – you’re approachable and service-minded.Fluent in Swedish and English (written and spoken).
* Interest in fitness, wellness, or healthy lifestyles is a big plus.


**Our values at Bruce Studios**
 At Bruce Studios, our values guide everything we do—from how we work together to how we engage with our community.
   

  

* Own it – We take responsibility, make decisions, and follow through. We’re proactive, honest, and always learning from our mistakes.
* Be engaged – We’re all in. We respect each other’s time, stay curious, and continuously strive to improve.
* Be real – Authenticity is key. We communicate openly, support each other, and create a safe space where everyone can be themselves.
* Be adaptable – Change is constant, and we embrace it. We find solutions, stay flexible, and innovate together.
* Be bold – We challenge the status quo, take risks, and push boundaries while treatingeach other with kindness and respect.


 Want to be part of a team that lives these values every day? Apply now.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* Fully renovated top-floor office with terrace, ideally located in central Stockholm
* 30 days of vacation
* Pension benefits
* Possibility to work 1-2 days remote per week
* A welcoming company culture and supportive team
* A Bruce Epic membership (yes, you get to workout too!)


**How To Apply**
 Does this role sound like the right fit for you? Great – we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 Apply directly via Teamtailor by uploading your CV (in English or Swedish) and adding a short personal note about why you're excited about this opportunity and how you’d contribute to the team.
   

  

 We review applications continuously and will move forward with candidates as soon as we find the right match – so don’t wait to apply!
   

  

 We value a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we warmly welcome applicants of all gender identities, ages, backgrounds, and abilities.

title: Frontend Engineer - Installation and Customer Care
description:
10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As an App Engineer on our Installation & Customer Care team, you'll build the digital tools that empower our field workforce to deliver clean energy solutions efficiently. You'll work across mobile apps and web platforms to create seamless experiences for installers, technicians, and support teams.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Own, build and maintain our installer mobile app using Flutter for iOS and Android
* Design digital workflows that replace manual paperwork and improve operational efficiency
* Build systems that enable real-time collaboration between installers, planners, and customer care
* Develop data collection and reporting tools to drive continuous improvement


 We're digitizing how clean energy gets installed and maintained. If you enjoy building tools that have real-world impact and working across the full technology stack, this role is for you.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Team**
* An interest in learning Flutter for mobile app development
* Experience with React
* Experience with agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban)


**What is in it for you?**
* Work at a fast-growing clean energy company making a real environmental impact
* Build tools that directly help field teams deliver clean energy solutions
* Collaborate with international teams and launch products globally
* Work across web, mobile, and backend technologies
* Hybrid work flexibility at our new Stockholm office near public transport
* Supportive, inclusive culture with career advancement opportunities


 At Aira, we believe diverse teams build better products. We welcome people from all backgrounds to help us create a cleaner energy future.

title: Breakfast Shift Leader
description:
Radisson Hotel Group is one of the world's largest hotel groups with ten distinctive hotel brands, and more than 1,460 hotels in operation and under development in 95+ countries. The Group’s overarching brand promise is Every Moment Matters with a signature Yes I Can! service ethos. People are at the core of our business success and future. Our people are true Moment Makers and together we bring the culture, spirit, environment and opportunities that empower you to be your best, every day, everywhere, every time. Together, we make Every Moment Matter.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 Are you a morning person? Do you share the passion for a good Breakfast? Are you as keen as mustard where service is concerned, whilst ensuring back of house is in order - whether it be a plate full of numbers, setting a schedule or laying the table for a successful team. Join us At Radisson Hotel Group, where every moment matters, and guests can savor the experience!
   

  

  

  

 We are currently seeking a Breakfast Shift Leader to join our vibrant team at Radisson Blu Royal Viking Hotel, Stockholm. At RHG, we are in search of individuals who go beyond the resume – those with character, skills, talents, and a passion for creating memorable experiences. We value mindset as pivotal: anticipating guest needs, supporting your department, and consistently delivering memorable experiences.
   

  

  

  

 As a Breakfast Shift Leader at The Radisson Blu Royal Viking Hotel, you bring a heightened level of ambition, a results-driven mindset, and a deep passion for enhancing the breakfast experience to our dynamic F&B Team.
   

  




* Supports the smooth running of the Breakfast department, where all aspects of the guest food & beverage service experience are delivered to the highest levels.



  

  




* Works proactively to improve guest satisfaction and comfort, delivering a positive and timely response to guest enquiries.



  

  




* Supports the delivery on plans and objectives where food & beverage initiatives & hotel targets are achieved.



  

  




* Supervises the Breakfast team fostering a culture of growth, development and performance within the department.



  

  




* Ensures adherence and compliance to all legislation where due diligence requirements and best practice activities are planned, delivered and documented for internal and external audit, performing follow-up as required.


**Qualifications**

 Experience in food & beverage service. Strong supervisory and managerial skills with a hands-on approach and lead-by-example work style. Commitment to delivering exceptional guest service with a passion for the hospitality industry. Ability to find creative solutions with proven problem-solving capabilities offering support where required. Personal integrity, with the ability to work in an environment that demands excellence, time and energy. Fluent Swedish & English is a must.
   

  

  

  




**Additional Information**

 Why Join Radisson Hotel Group?
   

  

  

  

 Live the Magic of Hospitality - Be part of a team that creates exceptional experiences and memorable moments every day. Let your Yes I Can! spirit shine as you bring hospitality to life.
   

  

  

  

 Build a Great Career - No matter your background or experience, we invest in your growth, learning, and career development—helping you reach your full potential.
   

  

  

  

 Experience the Team Spirit - Join a workplace that’s inclusive, fun, and meaningful. We celebrate diversity, support one another, and foster a sense of belonging through our Employee Resource Groups and inclusion initiatives.
   

  

  

  

 Lead with Your Ambition - Your ideas, passion, and drive matter! We empower you to make a difference—in hospitality, your community and beyond.
   

  

  

  

 Enjoy Global & Local Perks - No matter where you’re located, you’ll enjoy exclusive global benefits - like special hotel rates for you and your loved ones at our hotels worldwide. Plus, you’ll have access to local perks and rewards tailored to your country, making your experience even more rewarding!
   

  

  

  

 Join us in shaping the future of hospitality! If you’re ready to bring your talent, energy, and passion, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

  

  

 Apply now and let’s make every moment matter.
   

  

  

  

 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds, abilities, and experiences. If you need any adjustments during the application process, please let us know.

title: Project Manager
description:
**Project manager Vehicle Service Information (VSI)**
 TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation - Let´s make a difference together. Find out more: www.traton.com
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 Are you ready to take the lead in shaping how the next generation of trucks are serviced and supported?
   

  

 As Project Manager for Vehicle Service Information, you will be part of Traton´s digital transformation, driving projects that make advanced vehicle data accessible, reliable, and user-friendly for our global service network. In this role, you’ll combine leadership, innovation, and cross-functional collaboration to ensure that Traton’s service information evolves alongside our products and technologies. You’ll work closely with VSI management teams and development teams ensuring that our service information systems meet the highest standards of quality, usability, and efficiency.
   

  

**Job Responsiblities**
* Manage and lead the project/initative in organizing, monitoring, and executing current and future projects related to vehicle service information.
* Work closely with various cross-functional teams including R&D and IT, to ensure seamless integration and functionality of service information systems.
* Oversee the development and implementation of processes to ensure the highest quality of service information.
* Actively participate in planning and other specialist tasks to support project/initiative goals.


**Who You Are**
* You have an engineering degree or equivalent experience in a similar role.
* You have experience working as a project manager within IT.
* You are fluent in English.
* Comfortable working in a dynamic environment where both agile and traditional development methods are used.
* You can see the big picture and help the organization prioritize and improve work methods and processes when needed.
* Experience with Scania's product development process is a plus.


 We are looking for a natural leader who motivates others and can easily collaborate with people in various positions within the company. You can see the big picture, be holistic and look both upstream and downstream the flow as well as help the organization prioritize and improve work methods and processes when needed.
   

  

**This is us**
 Our department plays a central role by providing the information, tools, and systems required to maintain, diagnose, and repair transport solutions.
   

  

 We ensure these processes are carried out safely, with high quality, and cost-effectively. We also play a crucial role in product development by providing expertise and support to ensure the right solutions from a service perspective, ultimately giving Scania's workshop network the conditions to maximize the availability of our transport solutions.
   

  

 Our team is working in several exciting areas and we come from diverse backgrounds with a wide range of experience and expertise.
   

  

 We develop together and share experiences and knowledge to help each other in our daily work.
   

  

**Traton Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-11-11. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role. If you have questions or would like more information, please contact me: Martin Jättner, Group Manager, martin.jattner@scania.com
   

  

**I look forward to your application!
   

  

 This recruitment process is handled by Scania for TRATON Group R&D**

title: Product Manager
description:
Acne Studios is a progressive luxury house and through collaboration and curiosity, we set high aspirations and strive for excellence. We value everyone’s contribution and embrace feedback to develop ourselves and others. We aim to minimise our environmental impact across all our operations and to address societal challenges in the way we conduct our business.
   

  

 CULTURE OF COLLABORATION
   

  

 We firmly believe that when you feel supported, included, and trusted, it enables you to enjoy your work and thrive in it. You will be a part of a team of colleagues with diverse roles and backgrounds, each with their unique skills and experiences.
   

  

 WHAT YOU WILL DO
   

  

 As Product Manager within our knitwear team at the Stockholm head office, you will contribute to the development of high-end quality collections for knitwear product category in line with company standards and business goals for quality, cost, sustainability and delivery.
   

  

 As Product Manager, you will:
   

  

* Drive the development of premium collections aligned with quality, cost, sustainability, and delivery goals
* Manage the end-to-end development process
* Source and research materials to meet design briefs and sustainability targets
* Attend fittings and provide expert input on quality, fit, and construction
* Lead costing and margin analysis, supporting negotiation strategies
* Allocate styles to suppliers based on capabilities, standards, and pricing
* Maintain accurate product data and BOMs in PLM systems
* Monitor seasonal development budgets and ensure cost control
* Collaborate closely with suppliers and conduct on-site visits as needed
* Foster strong cross-functional partnerships to meet product requirements


 WHO YOU ARE
   

  

 You have high aspirations and focus on details that create substantial impact. You enjoy working as a team and you embrace feedback to develop yourself and others. You are curious and thrive in a dynamic environment. Cooperation, respect, and clear communication are important, along with your ambition to learn and grow. If these qualities speak to you, we would love to have you on our team.
   

  

 Specific experience and knowledge for this role:
   

  

* Academic degree, from fashion and or textile education
* Minimum 5 years’ experience within product development preferably from high-end fashion brands
* Hands on experience developing garments in knitwear
* Highly skilled in MS Office, especially Excel
* Solid costing and negotiation skills
* Experience with PLM systems (a plus)


 Specific personal qualities for this role:
   

  

* Builds strong, collaborative relationships with internal teams and suppliers
* Works in a structured, proactive way with great follow-through
* Solves problems creatively and cooperatively
* Communicates clearly and confidently in English, both written and spoken


 CULTURE OF COLLABORATION
   

  

 We firmly believe that when you feel supported, included, and trusted, it enables you to enjoy your work and thrive in it. You will be a part of a team of colleagues with diverse roles and backgrounds, each with their unique skills and experiences.
   

  

 What matters most to us is not whether you master all the listed knowledge and skills. We are dedicated to recognising the potential in each individual. We embrace diversity of people as well as ideas and viewpoints and encourage everyone's individual expression of their own identity.

title: Teknisk projektledare till försvarsindustrin!
description:
**Vi söker Tekniska projektledare till uppdrag hos våra kunder inom försvarsindustrin!**
 Våra kunder är globala och lokala leverantörer av ledande produkter, tjänster och lösningar inom militärt försvar och civil säkerhet.
   

  

 I denna roll får du det bästa av två världar - en trygg anställning hos ESSIQ samtidigt som du har möjligheten att växa och utvecklas genom olika projekt och kunduppdrag. Genom ett lyhört ledarskap och en öppen företagskultur vill vi ge varje medarbetare möjligheten att forma sin karriär och sin vardag.
   

  

 Orterna som är aktuella är Stockholm, Linköping, Göteborg, Lund med omnejd.
   

  

**ROLLBESKRIVNING**
 Som teknisk projektledare är du med och driver både leverans- och produktprojekt. Hos oss får du en nyckelroll i att leda integrationen av några av världens främsta system inom vårt område.
   

  

 Som teknisk projektledare har du det övergripande ansvaret för att säkerställa att projektet uppfyller tekniska krav inom budget samt levererar enligt plan. Rollen innebär ett ansvar över att leda och koordinera den tekniska verksamheten i projekten – både internt i våra team och externt mot kund.
   

  

 Att vara teknisk projektledare innebär även att:
   

  

* Leda och säkerställa framdrift gällande det tekniska arbetet inom projekten
* Ansvara för kund- och leverantörs kontakt för de tekniska aspekterna
* Stödja projektledaren med underlag vid kundkontakter
* Övervaka projektaktiviteter och säkerställa projektets åtaganden och framdrift genom aktivt ledarskap
* Koordinera och kravställa interna tekniska funktioner, inklusive definition av själva scopet för projektet, tidsplan, budget samt resursbehov
* Ha förmåga att genomföra systemanalyser av prospect, ha tillräcklig teknisk förståelse för att skapa underlag till kalkylarbeten och även driva/leda designaktiviteter


**OM DIG**
 Vi tror att du är en trygg och självgående individ som tillsammans med ditt team av kollegor aktivt strävar efter att driva organisationen framåt. Du har förmågan att enkelt identifiera områden för utveckling inom projekt samt uppskattar kontinuerligt lärande. Du kommunicerar tydligt, är lyhörd och inkluderande. Det är också viktigt att ha ett flexibelt tankesätt som gör att du kan anpassa dig till förändrade omständigheter i projektet och olika konsultuppdrag.
   

  

 För att passa denna roll
 **skall** 
 du ha:
   

  

* Högskole- eller Civilingenjörsexamen eller motsvarande utbildning eller erfarenhet som bedöms likvärdig.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med system- eller produktutveckling.
* Flerårig Erfarenhet av teknisk projektledning
* Svenskt medborgarskap (ej dubbelt medborgarskap)
* God förståelse för kravställande och kravställning.
* Flytande språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


 För att passa denna roll bör du ha:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av arbete med Systemspecifikation och/eller verifiering.
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med/mot leverantörer.
* Skicklig i planering med förmågan att organisera och prioritera ditt arbete effektivt för att arbeta mot fastställda deadlines.
* Erfarenhet från försvarsindustrin.


**OM TJÄNSTEN**
* Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning på heltid. 6 månaders provanställning tillämpas.
* Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
* Lön och förmåner: Konkurrenskraftig fast eller rörlig lön. Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter och generösa förmåner. Tjänstepension, omfattande försäkringar.


**OM ESSIQ**
 ESSIQ är teknikkonsultföretaget där allt börjar med dig. Med fokus på individen, flexibla lösningar och en modern lönepolicy attraherar vi de skarpaste, mest professionella och engagerade personerna i branschen. Med denna vision grundades ESSIQ år 2005, sedan dess har vi utvecklats till ett framgångsrikt företag med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö. Vi består idag av över 200 medarbetare med olika bakgrund, personlighet och nationalitet, med en god fördelning av kvinnor och män.
   

  

 Vi har över 80 aktiva kunder i spännande branscher – allt från de stora aktörerna till de små innovationsföretagen. ESSIQ:s medarbetare arbetar med användarcentrerad tjänste- och produktutveckling inom följande tjänsteområden: UX & Service Design, Connected & Embedded Systems, IT & Cloud Services, Green Technology & Electromobility, Test & Quality Engineering, Agile Management, Mechanical Engineering samt Simulation & Visualization. Kompetensen levererar vi på plats hos uppdragsgivaren, inhouse och i satellit. Våra medarbetares intressen och ambitioner leder vägen – vårt mål är att göra den perfekta matchningen av individ och uppdrag.
   

  

 ESSIQ är ett familjärt och socialt företag med visionen att vara Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare för alla medarbetare, oavsett roll i organisationen. Vi lägger stor vikt vid gemenskap och har ett uppskattat utbud av professionella och sociala aktiviteter. Vår kommunikationsplattform genomsyras av öppenhet, och främjar nätverkande och kompetensutbyte såväl som fritidsaktiviteter och relationsbyggande.
   

  

**ANSÖKAN**
 Ansökningar kommer hanteras löpande. Vänligen notera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via mejl med hänsyn till GDPR. Vi använder oss av rekryteringsverktyget Teamtailor. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande men skicka gärna in din ansökan redan idag.
   

  

 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och uppfyller gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. Bakgrundskontroller kommer att göras. Kan även innebära krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering, samt i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

**KONTAKT**
 Frågor om tjänsten? Kommunicera via vårt rekryteringsverktyg Teamtailor.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om ESSIQ?
   

  

 Besök http://essiq.se och följ oss på våra sociala medier!

title: Data Engineer till Sveriges Radio
description:
Företagsbeskrivning gömd på alla jobb på hela kontot. Kontakta Jobylon för att visa igen.
   

  

 När du lyssnar på Sveriges Radio är det 100 års konstant teknikutveckling du hör. Bakom varje program och sändning, i varje kanal och på varje plattform, finns ett kraftfullt fundament av innovativ teknologi som verkar tyst i bakgrunden – dygnet runt, året om – med höga krav på precision, tillgänglighet och robusthet.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en Data Engineer till vår dataplattform som fokuserar på att hjälpa medarbetare i hela Sveriges Radio att agera datainformerat i sin vardag. Om du trivs där modern teknik möter samhällsnytta – då är det här en roll för dig.
   

  

**Tjänsten**
 Som Data Engineer på Sveriges Radio blir du en del av vårt Datateam – cirka 10 personer – inom avdelningen Plattformstjänster på IT-enheten. Vi är ett tryggt och stöttande tvärfunktionellt team där samarbete, lärande och balans är lika självklart som teknisk kvalitet.
   

  

 Vi ansvarar för hela datakedjan: från insamling och bearbetning till tillgängliggörande av data. Plattformen är byggd i Databricks och Microsoft Azure, med fokus på robusthet, prestanda och framtidssäkerhet.
   

  

 I rollen som Data Engineer jobbar du i nära samarbete med övriga Data Engineers med att ta in data, garantera dess säkerhet och korrekthet genom hela flödet, samt leverera data till våra kollegor som är allt från utvecklare och analytiker till journalister, samt till våra externa samarbetspartners.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Designa, bygga och optimera data pipelines för batch och realtid.
* Arbeta nära andra roller i organisationen, så som PO, PM, utvecklare, analytiker och arkitekter.
* Driva best practices inom datahantering, self-service, automatisering och modulärt plattformsbyggande
* Stötta och coacha kollegor i teamet, både tekniskt och genom att bidra till en god samarbetskultur


**Vi söker dig som har**
* Relevant eftergymnasial utbildning eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Bakgrund som Data Engineer i Azure och/eller Databricks
* Erfarenhet av att skapa och underhålla skalbara dataintegrationer och pipelines.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift.


**Meriterande är också om du har erfarenhet av**
* Att arbeta med datamodellering och data governance
* Att driva tekniska vägval med fokus på hållbarhet, säkerhet och kostnadseffektivitet
* Erfarenhet av offentlig sektor eller annan komplex organisation med höga krav på datakvalitet och säkerhet.


 Vi söker dig som har god samarbetsförmåga och vill bidra till en lärande och stöttande teamkultur. Vi ser gärna att du har god kommunikationsförmåga och vana av att förklara komplexa tekniska koncept för både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter.
   

  

**Anställning**
 På Sveriges Radio samlas medarbetare med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och perspektiv – något vi ser som en förutsättning för att skapa innehåll som är relevant, trovärdigt och tillgängligt för hela samhället. Bakom varje program och sändning, i varje kanal och på varje plattform, finns ett fundament av innovativ teknologi. Det är den som möjliggör och förstärker vårt uppdrag att nå ut med berättelser som berör och engagerar.
   

  

 För att fortsätta bredda våra perspektiv och utvecklas som organisation ser vi varje rekrytering som en chans att växa. Vi välkomnar alla att söka våra tjänster – men vill särskilt uppmuntra dig som är kvinna eller icke-binär att söka denna roll, då vi i dag har en överrepresentation av män inom IT-enheten.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med inledande provanställning på sex månader. Du kommer att ha din arbetsplats på vårt kontor i Stockholm och visst distansarbete kan vara möjligt. Tillträde så snart som möjligt eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Ansökan och kontaktuppgifter**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med provanställning på 6 månader. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Sök med CV och svara på några korta frågor om rollen – urval sker löpande.
   

  

 För frågor om tjänsten: Björn Heselius, Gruppchef Dataplattform, bjorn.heselius@sr.se eller Andreas Bråth, Product Manager, andreas.brath@sr.se
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**
*Sveriges Radio är en del av Sveriges kritiska infrastruktur och har en viktig roll inom totalförsvaret. Vår verksamhet omfattas bland annat av regler om säkerhetsskydd och på grund av det genomförs en kontroll av kandidaten för många av tjänsterna i vår verksamhet innan anställning sker. För de tjänster som leder till deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet eller placering i säkerhetsklass innebär denna kontroll att säkerhetsprövning genomförs i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.*

title: Senior Project Manager
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Shape the Future of Scania Through Strategic Execution**
 You know the power of great execution - how it doesn’t just follow strategy, but shapes it. As Senior Project Manger at Scania’s Project Office, you will lead some of the most critical industrialization programs within Scania, turning strategic direction into tangible business results. Your leadership will make a real difference. You will guide complex, cross-functional programs from decision to delivery, ensuring seamless industrial introductions that meet Scania’s EBIT goals and strengthen our premium offering. Together with executive leaders and other project managers, you will help move Scania’s strategy from vision to value - always with the customer in focus.
   

  

**This is us**
 At the Scania Project Office, we lead programs and projects that define the future of Scania’s premium offering. We act where business and product meet, ensuring that strategy is realized through strong, value-driven execution. We believe in collaboration, coaching and continuous learning. Our mission is to make sure that product development and industrialization deliver real value, to our customers, our business and our people.
   

  

**We Offer**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses for an easy commute to Södertälje.
   

  

**Your Mission**
*In this role, you will:*
* Lead large-scale industrialization programs supporting Scania’s strategic goals when industrializing Product Development projects from TRATON GROUP PMO.
* Ensure successful execution of projects that are critical to Scania’s truck business profitability, securing smooth introductions without disruptions to the industrial system.
* Guide and coach other project and program managers at Scania’s Project Office, contributing to a strong and learning project culture.
* Navigate and lead business risks in forums such as OSG, PDC, PMC, PSC and PQ.
* Collaborate with executive leadership and provide strategic insight into Scania’s project portfolio, supporting both direct management and the executive board in decision-making.
* Drive clarity and alignment across complex interfaces, ensuring that stakeholders stay focused on common priorities and outcomes.


**Who You Are**
 You are an
 **experienced and trusted Project Manager** 
 with a strong track record of leading complex, high-impact projects. You bring both strategic perspective and operational precision, and you know how to drive results through others.
   

  

*We believe you have:*
* A Master’s degree, preferably in Engineering, Business, or an equivalent field.
* Significant senior project management experience, ideally gained within Scania or the wider TRATON Group. Experience from executive decision-making arenas is highly valued.
* Strong business understanding and the ability to balance strategic objectives with operational realities.
* Proven leadership experience, including leading other leaders and managing cross-functional teams.
* Full professional proficiency in English; Swedish is an advantage.


 Your leadership combines structure and empathy, and you bring stability, focus and collaboration even in high-stakes situations. You are as comfortable discussing strategic directions with executives as you are guiding your team through the day-to-day complexities of execution.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a
 **CV** 
 and any relevant
 **certificates** 
 . We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes!
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible but no later than
 **2025-11-11** 
 . Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

**If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:**
 Therese Sandberg, Manager, therese.sandberg@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Sales Executive in Sweden
description:
Would you like to join the leading business technology company in the Nordics? Do you speak both business and technology fluently? If yes, keep reading!
   

  

 Sofigate is growing fast and we are now seeking for a highly motivated deal maker who will change the way people see sales leaders at Sofigate. You are a passionate problem solver and highly motivated to learn and spar together with customers and use your professionalism to find fit-for-purpose solutions creating true business value for the customer.
   

  

 Your ability to convince the stakeholders will consist of both rational and emotional aspects addressing customer’s needs and doubts. You possess a deep curiosity for technology and AI and you already use AI actively in your work.
   

  

 You lead by example and coach customer executives to perform at their best. You also lead our highly talented people at your named customers and inspire them with customers’ mission and objectives.
   

  

 Experience in selling digital transformation programs—ideally linked to technical and digital solutions, with knowledge of platforms like ServiceNow and Salesforce seen as a strong plus—is highly valued. This experience enables you to articulate end-to-end value for the customer by bridging platform capabilities with strategic consulting expertise.
   

  

 Experience from license sales—preferably within the ServiceNow and or Dynatrace ecosystem—is considered a strong advantage, as it enables you to drive end-to-end value from both platform and consulting perspectives.
   

  

 We’re looking for someone who thrives as a deal maker—someone with a stellar track record in sales who believes that exceptional performance should be matched by equally exceptional earnings. You understand that true, long-lasting success is never achieved alone; you're a team player who genuinely enjoys celebrating wins together and lifting those around you. What drives you is a passion for your customers’ businesses. You engage in meaningful dialogue and are naturally curious, always seeking to understand and solve the challenges your customers face.
   

  

 Your background speaks volumes: it’s versatile and rooted in experience from growth-focused companies, making you adaptable, driven, and innovative. One of your standout qualities is your ability to build strong relationships, particularly at the C-level. You’re trusted, you communicate clearly and effectively in both Swedish and English, and you know how to foster long-term partnerships that go beyond the transaction.
   

  

 In addition to your experience, you bring with you a strong network—one that includes potential customers, partners, and key industry contacts. This network helps accelerate opportunities from day one. With around ten years of sales experience, including leadership responsibilities, or a strong ambition to grow into such a role, you’re ready to take the lead and make an impact.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Lead few strategic accounts and drive +20% annual growth
* Ensure the happiness and engagement of Sofigator colleagues at your named accounts
* Actively identify and pursue new business opportunities
* Build and inspire exceptional customer relationships
* Lead customer executives
* Contribute insights to the development of our service offerings.


**What’s in it for you?**
 Want to work with world-class technologies, best-in-class business technology management practices and a team of experts? You’re in the right place with us.
   

  

 As a Sofigator, you get the opportunity to work with knowledgeable and driven colleagues, develop and challenge yourself and create sustainable value for our customers. We have an international, vibrant and fun culture with great openness and flexibility. We value every Sofigator and strive to build a diverse, equal, and inclusive workplace where everyone’s voice is heard, and where everyone can become the best versions of themselves. We value a healthy work life balance and support you in maintaining it.
   

  

 Growth is not just a corporate thing for us – it is personal. There is so much to explore and learn within our community, and together with our customers, that having a bit of fun is unavoidable.
   

  

**We would like to hear from you**
 Tell us your story and let us know why you are the change maker we are looking for.
   

  

 If you have any questions, please contact: Robert Lingemark, Country Manager Sweden, robert.lingemark[@]Sofigate.com
   

  

**About Sofigate**
*We are The Business Technology Company with the fastest time-to-value in the gen AI era. We achieve that by combining our transformation expertise with low/no-code platforms and generative AI. That’s how we create sustainable customer value. In practice, that means helping our customers to develop the interplay between business and technology: to design, build and implement transformations and business-friendly technology solutions, like Salesforce, ServiceNow and SAP.*

title: Quantitative Analyst - Risk Model
description:
**About Kambi**
*Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.*
*Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.*
 Are you a data-driven problem solver with a passion for algorithms and predictive modeling? Kambi is looking for a Quantitative Analyst - Risk Model to join our Quantitative Analysis team in central Stockholm. This role offers the chance to research and develop cutting-edge algorithmic solutions that power our B2B Sportsbook operations.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Build and maintain risk models, supporting trading, risk, and business teams with algorithmic solutions.
* Lead the end-to-end development of predictive algorithms—from concept to deployment and ongoing maintenance.
* Analyze large datasets to uncover patterns, trends, and actionable insights.
* Communicate complex findings to both technical and business stakeholders.


**What we’re looking for** 
 :
   

  

  

* Degree in a quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, etc.).
* Experience designing predictive models for real-world business problems.
* Strong knowledge of stochastic processes, probability, and advanced mathematical methods.
* Skilled in R, SQL, or similar tools for data analysis.
* Excellent communication skills.
* Experience with cloud computing (AWS) or Apache Spark is a plus.


**What sets you apart:**
* Creative and curious mindset, eager to experiment with data.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Passionate about innovation and data-driven decision-making.
